reviews_data.review_text: Don't order tea here if you like black tea, better bang-for-buck sausage breakfast burrito can be found down the street at Rhino Deli Market (imo mcdonalds might even have better bfast burritos...), but apparently the coffee is pretty good

Little nice place but very disappointed to have most finished my quiche and my husband already had finishe his biscuit sandwich before they bring our coffees. When I complained the girl told me that usually they bring the food before the coffee.

This place is super popular but honestly the way it's set up is odd to me. Also one of the doors is just locked unless an employee lets you in but the one next to the parking lot (not the sidewalk) is unlocked? It's just odd. Also, why should you have to order outside if you're going to go sit inside? However if you want to sit outside it also works well with the order and pickup windows preventing too much congestion in one area. Food items are overpriced but the drinks are standard pricing and tasty so not much of a complaint there.
In Simple words, whenever I get a chance I drive like 10 miles to get their coffee. One reason is because of their coffee but the other big reason is the restaurant itself. So ambient.

I had high hopes for this place. I just couldn't understand it. We had reservations to eat inside. We had no idea where to go. The doors were locked. We saw a woman carrying a tablet who took another table of people inside, so we thought we just had to wait for her to come back out to seat us. She never did. We went up to a window to ask what we needed to do. That guy told us to go up to the other window, skip the line, and tell them we had a reservation. I did that. The person at that window said we needed to wait in line, order our food, and then we'd be let inside. What was the point of having a reservation if we had to be in the same line as everyone else? When we finally got inside, my friend received her food and coffee, and I didn't receive mine. My friend sat there not eating until an employee walked by and asked why she wasn't enjoying her food. That was the only reason I ever even got my food. The breakfast burrito was tiny, but the coffee was good. We walked down the street and got Reigning Doughnuts immediately afterward because we were still hungry. All in all, it was a disappointing stop. Love the coffee mural on the side of the building though!

I have been a customer for years, I buy their beans and have been getting breakfast and coffee at least 2√ó a week for years. The product is good but customer service and the odeko online ordering was a little less than successful today. I placed an order 25 minutes ago and am still waiting.  Can't talk to anyone as the windows closed and no updates. I understand there are staffing shortages but please update the app accordingly and provide realistic expectations. I waited way too long and got the wrong items. They still have the best coffee in town

The Smelly Cat Coffee House was highly rated, so my crew and I went out of our way to visit. I ordered an espresso in a ceramic cup and two pour overs to go. After 20 or so minutes and the other folks getting their drink (at various times), I inquired on my drinks. The espresso was sitting in a paper cup waiting to come out with the pour overs that were still not done. When I reminded them that the espresso was supposed be in a ceramic cup, the took the old espresso and dumped it in a ceramic cup. It was cold and no good- a waste of money. The pour overs were just okay. I was super bummed. It did not live up to the hype.
One of the best coffeehouses in Charlotte. Always get friendly service. Love their breakfast biscuits!
Yummy food, tasty drinks, cool atmosphere...LOVE IT!!!
Great little coffee shop
Got their frappe with vanilla. So good!! Liked it better than the Starbucks bottled frappuccinos. Will be returning for

This place looked amazing online but was a little underwhelming, sadly. The place is still beautiful, and the employees are incredibly kind. The parking is non-existent, the setup is inconvenient, which if the coffee was amazing I would completely look over. I drink black coffee and dark roasts are my go to, but I think there was something not right with this coffee. There was something about it that was bitter/almost burnt, that left a bad aftertaste after each sip. The breakfast options are a great idea, I do wish there were options for adding something spicy, different sauces, etc. As far as I could tell there weren't any listed on the board.
Helpful staff, friendly faces and dogs, pets welcomed and scrumptious mocha frappe!
Great coffee, friendly staff. This place always makes my day a bit better

$6.25 for that. This was the most pitiful thing I had ever seen and don't know how a company could actually serve this. We actually had to make more food after spending $30 on two of these and two coffees. Just ridiculous, do better.

Stopped for a quick coffee on my way out of town. I much prefer local business over chains and the evil Bucks. Found this spot on Google and figured I'd give it a shot. Meh. Disappointing considering the reviews I'd read. Got a coffee and a breakfast burrito and found both decidedly average at best. It may have its perks but the coffee wasn't one in my opinion.

This place is my favorite coffee shop in Charlotte. I'm always impressed with the quality of the drinks and the swiftness of the staff. A very friendly staff as well. Unfortunately today 9/1/22 there was a middle aged woman taking orders and her presence seemed to bog down their whole operation. Every person who ordered was handed shots of coffee to try, which was a nice sentiment, but certainly increased wait times. I love coming to this place, but one disruptive element certainly threw off the shops flow today.
Nice location, friendly staff and good espresso! Definitely helped with a hangover üòÑ

Finally got a chance to try Smelly Cat and it did not disappoint!! I got the Ethiopian cold brew which was fantastic. My parents got herbal teas. I didn't get to try any of the food as we had just come back from Amelie's so I can't speak to that.  Service was very friendly, helpful with suggestions, and patient with decisions even though they were busy.  They had ample outdoor seating which was really nice but I couldn't tell what was going on with the indoor seating. The door to the inside looked to be locked and there was a sign saying that anyone who wanted in could get assistance from the barista. Maybe still a covid thing? Anyway, can't speak to the inside aesthetic either but I will definitely be back for more Ethiopian cold brew!

Got an oat milk latte with spiced brown sugar, delicious. Just strong enough and sweet enough. I also got a few of the roasted beans, so far I've only tried the Ethiopian Yirgachefe (I may or may not have spelled that correctly). This one has been great

If you have never been here before, beware that it's not set up like a regular coffee shop. I came on a Sunday and couldn't figure out how to get inside the cafe as the front door was locked. I walked around the building and the side window was closed too. I saw other people sitting outside and had to ASK how I can order coffee: you have to "ring the doorbell" at the side window, place your order, and ask them to unlock the door so you can sit inside. Aside from that, the coffee itself was great.
omg! i got an iced dirty chai and it was so good! i never write reviews but it was just so great i had to write one! a bit pricy but worth it imo

They were hesitant to let us (4 adults & 2 babies on a very hot day) inside due to limited seating. We all bought coffee and pastries. No baby changing setup in bathrooms. All in all, cramped hipster coffee joint if that's your thing. Not family friendly. Excited to try their coffee in other spots that are more open & welcoming.
I absolutely love Smelly Cat. The coffee is always always a hit for me

Waited at the window for ten minutes to order due to ‚Äúan iPad issue.‚Äù Then ordered two drinks at the first window and went over to the second to pick them up. They had only made us one, so we asked for the second. The server stared at us blankly like he had stopped functioning, literally saying nothing. After awkward silence, we asked again and were told we'd have to get back in line‚Äîwhich was 16 people long at this point due to the ‚ÄúiPad issue‚Äù‚Äîand order again. No thanks.  To make sure we hadn't paid for the second drink, I asked for a receipt. He said he could only text or email it, so I gave my phone number. Realizing that he was only pretending to take down the number, probably assuming I'd be walking away, I told him I'd wait at the window until it came through. Then, he got a pen and asked for the number again. What respectable service. üëèüèº  The one drink was good, so I'll give them a second star for that, but the service is clearly lacking.
Great place to meet friends in NODA
Such a fun spot to hangout and grab a bite or some coffee. This is the best coffee house around!

The coffee was excellent. They roast the coffee and I had a cold brew, which totally hit the spot. We had an egg, sausage & chees on a biscuit as well as a protein bowl. We both thought the food was really good. Well worth the visit
Best cup of cappuccino I've had in Charlotte so far! Friendly service as well.
The breakfast bowls are excellent. The folks behind the counter are always welcoming and lovely. Excited to have this as my neighborhood coffee shop

I am giving this place one star because zero is not an option. The girl taking orders told party they didn't do iced coffee, we had to get cold brew which was terribly bitter. But moments later someone behind us ordered iced coffee. I ordered a breakfast burrito It was cold, under cooked and I didn't get the hot sauce I asked for with it. They served two people in line behind us before I had to go up and ask where mine was and why other people who ordered after me were being served. Terrible place, terrible service, terrible coffee.
Coffee is decent, staff is not pleasant. Not family friendly... Twenty something's only I guess.
The coffee was very good. I had the Ethiopian (both hot and cold brew)! I had the bacon, egg cheese on a toasted plain bagel. It was very good, aa well. The atmosphere was great! Positive vibes.

I was in town for a couple of days and wanted coffee before starting our adventure for the day.  We got 2 breakfast items and 2 coffees.  (25$ btw) Got the coffees right away and it was BAD.  It was very bitter and we didn't even get half way through before throwing them away. They made us step aside for the food so that they can serve the customers behind us in line.  Well we waited‚Ä¶ and waited‚Ä¶ and there was no indication our food was done other than the fact that people that stood behind us in line were getting their complete order and no one ever said anything to us.  We went back to barista at the window that had our food sitting behind her the entire time!! Halfway back to the car we realized we were missing half of the order so we had to walk all the way back (parking was full so we were 2 blocks away.) luckily the quiche was actually pretty tasty so they mildly redeemed themselves.  Over all, not a great experience.  This is a place where if you judge it by it's cover it should be good but in reality the looks surpass the quality.  Go to Amelie's instead.

My wife and I visited just after 12 noon on Sunday. They were quite busy with constant in person orders and pick up orders. They were pretty quick to fill orders. The shop has a great atmosphere both inside and out. Plenty of people hanging out in the patio areas, which were on the front, side and in the back under a big tree. My wife had a chai tea which was ok but didn't have the kick she was expecting for a chai. I had a mocha frappe which was good but the roasted coffee flavor was very strong making it unbalanced. I had hoped they had some sugar free offerings in their syrups, but the only thing they had were some sugar free teas. We also had a piece of zucchini bread which was pretty good. Overall I'd give it a 3.5.

They have a 5 star rating for a reason, this roaster/restaurant is top notch. Between the excellent service and amazing coffee, this is a place to go to. I was privileged enough to meet the owner who is extremely kind and knowledgeable about her products. If you're looking for a cute spot to work or grab a quick bite to eat, this is your spot.
Mainstay in Noda and perfect place to hangout in the morning. Service is very slow though, they should expedite pouring someone a simple coffee instead of waiting for all the food orders ahead.
I come here every morning for coffee and breakfast! Very tasty and good customizablity!
Sweet cool little place love the sitting place under the tree in the summer and the coffee is just plain amazing.
Really good chai latte. Staff is fabulous. Nice patio to sit outside.
Coffee is great. Spot is cute. Food is fine. Salty eggs.

Omg there caramel frappe is to die for best frozen coffee drink I've ever had I won't be going to Starbucks anymore thanks to the wonderful young lady ahead of me who paid for my order since I couldn't get my card to work you're the bomb thanks smelly cat
Stopped going here after being harased by the staff. Harasment goes both ways.  I went here every day for a long time untill the wait staff made me very uncomfortable.  Havent been back since.

Second time here over my weekend trip to Charlotte. If you are in/around/near NODA you have to at least get a coffee. Almost everything on the menu is made in house, from the coffee roasting to the baked goods. Everything I had was delicious and the staff was inviting and welcoming. They even asked how our latte was when we went to order seconds. Also if you are visiting with a dog there is a side window to order and plenty of outdoor seating. Thank you so much for the amazing food and vibe! Definitely a highlight of our stay in Charlotte.
It was great. Extremely friendly staff. Cute cats. Coffee was good.
So happy they are finally open. Great place to work before yoga!

Wonderful, welcoming and cozy atmosphere. Do not come in if you're in a rush ... This is not Starbucks. It's designed to be an experience. Take a break and truly savor. They have the best blueberry muffin I've ever eaten. The sausage egg and cheese burrito was excellent. My husband enjoyed the Vietnamese iced coffee with a splash of caramel. I swoon for the dirty chai latte. Width stopping by if you're in the area. Will definitely be back!
It's a OK spot to pick up a  cup
Kathy and her son have a great neighborhood coffee shop with plenty of accessories!

Can I say it??? Ima say it‚Ä¶. This coffee is the best coffee I have hadüôåüèæ sooooooo good and strong. This is my second time coming and I can finally leave a review. I had to wait until the second visit because the first was just too good to be true! I couldn't even get a good picture of my Spiced Brown sugar oat milk latte. I blinked and it was goneüòÇ
Good ambience, coffee and breakfast. Great place for a coffee date.
Great service!!! Also the coffee was amazing. I had an iced brown sugar latte that was delicious. The sausage, egg, and cheese burrito was the perfect breakfast. I will be back!!
I asked for a strong not bitter coffee. I received a very bitter coffee. I was not impressed.

I am visiting Charlotte and I walk to Smelly Cat every morning to get coffee when I am walking my dogs. After the first day, Caleb and the other people working there called me by name when I walked up to the window. Amazing, friendly service and great coffee.
Smelly Cat Coffee House & Roastery was very good place. Coffee was awesome and service also fine.

First time here. Just Passing through. Wish inside was open! Dreary morning standing outside. But it's ok.  Ordered the Black cat coffee in a pour over. It's good! Definitely will go back next time in the area to try other things! Almost thought there might be smelly cats running around üòÇüòÇüòÇ #smellycatcafe
Best coffee I've ever had.
The  Drip coffee and Quiche are worth living for. The staff are always amazing and it's the best vibes of local coffee.
Cute spot in NoDa! Great coffee and relatively quick service. Nice outdoor spaces and great for people watching in the area!
Favorite spot to get a chai tea latte and puppychino for my dog.
It was wonderful great service and flavorful food I must say
Chill vibe and awesome coffee
Great ‚òïcoffee
Delicious food and drink, plus Natalie is dope af.
Such a chill & eclectic little place  with friendly service, good food/coffee, and beautiful scenery all around.  I don't get to come here often, but when I do it sure is a treat.

Had a great time at Smelly Cat this morning! Sunday morning, so it was really crowded and had a long wait but it was well worth it. The lemon herb cream cheese was to die for and my fianc√© got the bacon cheese biscuit and it was very good. Worth the trip!!!

One of the best coffee shops in Charlotte. Italian sizes and coffee with extra mess. Once the inside is open is also a great spot to sit and relax. They also have a limited alcoholic menu that varies from Beer to cocktails.
I'd recommend the coffee, not the food. My biscuit had obvious mold on the top.
Staff is very friendly but tea lacked flavor and the sandwiches were bland.

I've been to many, many coffee shops and Smelly Cat is honestly one of my favorites. They consistently have the best coffee around. They make the best iced dirty chai I've bought.They're breakfast burritos are also always a solid choice. A few of my other favorites from here include the vanilla latte and their iced Americano.  The employees are always friendly. They've got a nice chill atmosphere, both indoor seating (when it's allowed) and outdoor seating. I love that they're locally owned and roast their beans. This was a regular place to visit when I lived in Charlotte and I still make sure to stop in anytime I'm near Noda.
Super cute place.  Excellent little menu & coffee.  Get the biscuitüòÅ

Friendly people, solid coffee and a relaxing atmosphere. My one complaint is that, in the last month, three or four of my orders have been messed up. I'm not sure if it's the masks or busy line, but the cashier keeps taking down the wrong size or leaving items off. I would suggest double checking everything before it's finalized.
Beautiful and cozy coffee shop!

Cute and modest- great coffee and ambiance. With COVID there is now a to-go window on the patio which is also adorable and spacious with lots of flowers üå∏  Grab a pack of stickers or some swag if you're visiting from out of town ‚òïÔ∏è
Amazing coffee and vibes! I knew I had to try it out when I was in the Charlotte area.
Loved my bagel and tea!
Yummy coffee and great vibes!  I like sitting at the table by the sunflowers

They do not accept cash or allow customers in to the store. I understand that they took restrictions for covid but now those restrictions need to be lifted and the business should return to normal. I will not be back until cash is accepted and customers are allowed inside. It is a shame, I was once quite fond of this establishment. Employees are very friendly.

Coffee was absolutely amazing, vibes were incredible, staff was super sweet and friendly. Now, if you need somewhere to absolutely CLEAN your stomach out, go to this place. I don't know what MAGIC, is in their beverages but my gut is clean, clear and my body is EMPTIED‚Ä¶..of all toxins after I drank this beverage. 12/10 recommend, absolutely amazing for the gut health.
This was a very cute little walkup spot. Very friendly ladies working the order & pickup windows. Wrote a really cute note on my breakfast bag. Made me smile! Glad I went there.
Traveling into town for my first time and couldn't resist this place by name only. 4 minutes from my Airbnb and great staff, atmosphere and neighborhood!! Highly recommended :)
Awesome service. Great coffee
The coffee at Smelly Cat is smooth, strong, and tasty housemade syrups. This has been my favorite coffee shop for years.
Great local shop with quality food and drinks.

We totally had to visit smelly cat based off local reviews and appreciated the friendly service! Really convenient location in a fun corner of Charlotte. Loved the cool eclectic decor and seating outside for some fresh air! Thankful for some actually really good decaf!
The fact that they even have a cortadito on the menu is worthy of a 5 star, but the coffee itself was really smooth and flavorful.
Best walk up breakfast place, we came back twice on our trip to NoDa. Plenty of first come seating around the building also

Love this place! Been here a few times and now it's my go to coffee spot. Asked for recommendations and the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable, made me feel welcome. They're environmentally friendly and don't give straws (except metal/silicone ones you can purchase for $2) and the patio is dog friendly. I always ask for a pupiccino and put a cookie in it. Outdoor seating is enough to appease the crowds and the wait time is minimal, not to mention there's free wifi. I recommend looking at their specialty menu, the alcoholic drinks are awesome! Didn't even taste too strong like other drinks I've tried. The parking is usually ok but keep in mind they close kinda early and will close off the parking lot by 5pm. Overall great spot for some affordable tasty coffee.
Friendly, fast, delicious, Great!
Absolutely my number 1 cafe in charlotte.  Super friendly staff and very good coffee with some food options. Love the vibes!
Great Chai Latte
I love this place, super yummy and great eclectic atmosphere!
You have an exterior service window. I was outside, six away from the server. Why would I need a mask in order for you to serve me?  Please stop discriminating against people with medical conditions!
Delicious coffee and food, all in a fun location. Have a walk up window which makes things easy during this crazy COVID time. 2 thumbs up!
Great Coffee! Great Service

Coffee and Breakfast sandwich I got here were both really good! I personally enjoy a lighter roasted coffee than they offered so I would suggest they start to brew two pots, one light and one normal. You can sort of customize your breakfast sandwich, so that's cool If ur into that sorta thing. The decor of the place is nice, but I cannot comment about the vibes cuz we were all sitting out in the covid cold waiting for our food. Hope to be back here in a world less controlled by local jurisdiction.
Great coffee, cool location! Dog friendly!

Awesome little place! They have togo windows which made it very easy to order and get your things. Accommodating with today's times, of course the coffee is really good which is important but a combination of their really really nice service was awesome to me imo. Maybe it was just the two girls working today because I don't come here often but they were super friendly and nice and my latte was good af so 5 stars from me lol.

Great experience.  They really have their covid procedures dialed in.  one window for ordering and one window for pickup and plenty of outdoor space to hang out while waiting.  I'm a big fan of their noda nights espresso beans.  I buy the big bag in whole bean format to put in my super automatic Jura espresso machine.  The americanos and cappuccinos turn out fantastic.  The espresso bean flavor profile pairs nicely with oat milk.  But hey what coffee doesn't üòâ

Love the play on the TV show Friends. They have many coffee options as well as choices with liquor in them, great cure for any hangover! There is a cute seating area outside as well and it was a great place to relax for a little bit. Staff was friendly.
Staff was very nice and friendly, caramel frappe was amazing!
Smelly Cat is consistent in a positive way! They are always nice, their coffee is on point, and mmmmm, those breakfast burritos!!! Always my #1 coffee spot in Noda!
Had no idea what a sledgehammer was. It's 2 oz of liquid. More like a ballpeen hammer if you ask me. Still yummy.
Legit.

Great coffee, friendly staff, LOVELY outdoor seating areas in a cute part of town. Post-Demic this is highly recommend.  During COVID, you should be aware they do not enforce their "masks required" policy. Here's a man who waited in line, ordered, and was served, with no mask.
always thought the coffee was gross, and i have not been back since they showed their true colors and tore down and destroyed someone else's property, i have not been back.
Best dirty chai in Charlotte! A must stop for any coffee lover visiting the area. Well worth any wait!

I will start by saying I love this place. I live about 25 minutes away and every so often I'll take the trip to get their chai frappe, dirty. Today was a little different.  I really don't have time to go through all the details but they got my order wrong, and then blamed me for it, and was unwilling to do anything about it. What it really boils down to is the reality that they didn't like the fact that I wasn't wearing a mask. It didn't matter that we were outdoors, and socially distanced, "I was having a hard time understanding you because you weren't wearing a mask" is what I was told by the manager.....okay üôÉdefinitely my last visit.

Maybe it's a Saturday morning thing, but every time I'm here they mess up orders and take extremely long to make simple drinks. I love their coffee & build your own breakfast sandwich but it took them 15 mins to get my coffee out and I've had to re-tell them my order before because they somehow lost it? Definitely disappointing.

So, if you are lactose intolerant just like me. You can't place orders online for food with no cheese because their system doesn't allow to do it unless you order through the window. Very disappointed, by the way they won't refund if you already ordered food and added the comments NO CHEESE... "Because it's the system"

Fire. Period. I had the best dirty chai I've ever had in my life (and I've had a lot of them) at this joint. Beautiful Sunday afternoon, outdoor seating, tunes were on point. If I could recreate the moment every single day I'd be the better for it. Never change Smelly Cat!

I'm a big fan of local places that aren't chains. My wife and I have been going here for years and it's a great place. Great coffee and when they open the inside back up they have Wi-Fi and board games. With covid 19, they have chairs outside and you can still access their Wi-Fi. Definitely check it out if you haven't had a chance to yet.  By the way, you can also by bags of their coffee beans. We get the Noda Nights for our espresso machine and they grind it their for us.
Pretty good coffee, good people.

Best coffee stop in NoDa!! The staff is so friendly and helpful!! The girl who took care of us was super enthusiastic about coffee and happy to help us find what we'd like best based on our taste! And it was absolutely delicious of course :)
Great coffee! Friendly service.
Love this place...

Extremely friendly and helpfully staff always!! Great name and always fresh coffee available. I would of given 5 stars but I'm not from around here and was only here for a few days and didn't want to download a special app to pre-order our breakfast so I called to place order and I guess with all the fancy technology they can't take orders over the phone. They are also cashless so be prepared

Long waits,  out of many items, errors with 50 percent of the orders, and NO cash. Coffee was $6 tried to pay with a ten was told ‚ÄúI can't take cash, I don't have a drawer.‚Äù Told him to keep the rest then he said well we aren't taking cash at all . No where on their site is this listed. What do you expect though from try hard hipsters? I will take my CASH elsewhere.
(Translated by Google) Thank coffee  (Original) Dank coffee
This place is great. Cold brew was great, pastries & desserts are tasty as well. THEY DESERVE THE 5  STARS.
Never visiting again
The no carb breakfast bowl is awesome.
Great place to sit outside and chill.
Open for business with a touch of social diatance for safety.
Good
Best coffee I've ever had. I drive from Tennessee sometimes just to have there coffee. You can never go wrong with smelly cat
My happy place. I drive from 45 minutes away every Sunday just for their cold brew.
Really good coffee drinks and desserts.

Small and unique. Had a good pour over and enjoywdlled sitting out front. They are lacking much indoor seating but the neighborhood is nice and fun, so sitting outside is enjoyable. They offer some food, plenty of coffee options, and some alcohol. Great, fun, local coffee shop experience.
I had coffee here once and end up visiting often!they have coffee which tastes really good and serve gluten free bites. The service is fast and the staff are always smiling.
The world needs more places like this üòé
Great coffee. Great atmosphere.
Great coffee, cool atmosphere
Owner is awful.  Plenty of other coffee places in town. Don't give this woman any more money.
Owner is a vicious thief.
Such a unique place with plenty of seating indoor and outside! Great service and fair prices! The barista even asked if I needed samples before I bought anything!

Always a favorite of mine when in NODA. Throughout the week their open from 6:30 am until 3 p.m. and the weekends until about 10p.m. I knew the owner form years ago at the Statesville location. Until he moved into the building in NODA. It was so nice to find out that they kept it open after Richard passed a few years ago. I would suggest anything they have to offer. From pastries to coffee and beer and some wines, you can't beat their price. My over all favorite is their sledgehammer. A shot of their house made espresso with a little chocolate.  It give just the right sweetness but with the true taste of the coffee bean. Not to mention, the smelly cat is names as you've guessed it, from Phoebe from Friends and her song " smelly cat" it's definitely an on the list of things to see in NODA.
Love this place!

Cool little place that practices sustainable recycling.  Dishes, cups, paper and aluminum foil are left in individual containers by the door.  This is a huge plus for me.  Very friendly staff that while super busy, still kept the atmosphere light and genuinely enjoyed interacting with their customers.  Oh yeah, the black coffee that I ordered tasted wonderful.
Good food, people, place-the decor & music was awesome.  Visitor from Chiefs Kingdom-COME HEREüçµüç©üèàüéâ
Great little spot for coffee and/or Irish coffee

Saw a lot or reviews for this ‚Äúcute little coffee shop‚Äù‚Äî- emphasis on little, from the limited seating and parking lot to the one person gender neutral bathrooms. Had a fine experience but don't expect a plethora of seating during peak hours

Fast service, friendly employees, and the caramel latte was so good! The space is very small but there is outdoor seating which worked out fine. Parking is a bit of a hassle to find be there is a public parking deck a block away.

While visiting from NY, I was very impressed by this place. A friends theme coffee shop with a modern interior to keep you interested. From ‚Äúprivate sitting areas‚Äù that are divided by doors, to the unique paintings & decorations made it an amazing adventure to hang out with someone & talk whilst drinking some very good coffee.  Would highly return 10/10  P.S. Shoutout to whomever thought it was a good idea to write the name of the restaurant on the sidewalk cement.
Ordered a frozen coffee then learned there are no straws. We saved a straw but may kill two people and baby when I crash while trying to sip a frozen drink out of a cup while driving.
This place has become one of my favorite coffee shops! My favorite drink is the Sweet New Orleans cold brew coffee. Friendly staff and cool atmosphere!
Charlotte staple coffee Cafe and roaster. A must have in Noda area.
Their hot coco and vanilla lattes are delicious. They also came out and brought us a puppachino. Really nice staff.

Are the prices higher than your average coffee shop? Yes! BUT, you certainly get what you pay for here. My iced dirty chai was perfectly sweet, and my breakfast bowl was filled with fluffy scrambled eggs, fresh arugula and tomatoes, and a (surprisingly!) generous serving of ripe avocado.  While this would not be an every day coffee run for me due to the price point, this will certainly be my new go-to for when I feel like treating myself- and I would happily recommend it to anyone!
As inviting and cozy as it was years ago when it was on Union Street in concord
Cozy and eclectic!

This was my first time. I googled late night coffee shop, it popped up, had great reviews and off I was. Lol. I must say it has such a cool, and relaxing vibe. Love the decor,  coffee/tea options, the general vibe.
Great coffee from great people.  Grab one and stroll the neighborhood!
Love! Chill vibe, great background music, and nice atmosphere with plenty of seats to get your work done or sit and chat. Coffee and service were great too üëçüèº
Great little place.  Coffee was good

Yes we all get it.  This is one of if the the best small Coffee shop in the entire Charlotte area.  Just don't get too much of a big ego about it okay?  When you walk in here the interior design is immaculate.  The lighting is perfect.  The staff is quirky, confident and professional.  They also have a great seating area in front and under a patio.  Expect to see someone doing some really hip activity like writing a poem in a journal or making beaded jewelry when you go here.  It is a definite place that has been a great contributor to the hipness of NODA.
Did not actually visit but the atmosphere appeared to be oh so lovely!

Small yet inviting! I love spaces that have a bar you for you to sit and work at!!  They have a wonderful variety of cold brews and different coffee drinks. The outdoor seating is perfect for grabbing coffee and quick breakfast with a friend.  I'll definitely be coming back!

Cute local coffee house in the NoDa area of Charlotte. We only tried coffee but I found out that they do sandwiches and pastries too but a small bar for alcohol beverages too. The frappe was delicious and served quickly.
Delicious coffee but the place inside is very crowded, not super comfortable chairs either.. outside is better when the weather is mild.

Small and cozy.  Seating inside and outside.  Coffee drinks made to perfection.  Some alcohol served. Have breakfast or lunch and never be disappointed with the food.  Perfect place to dine with friends or to spend a couple of hours working.  Most important:  staff is slways friendly.  You are greeted with enthusiasm every time.

I have been an avid customer buying their roasted beans every 2 to 4 weeks for the past two years. I went in this morning and purchased another bag of their beans and was reading with my six-year-old across the street for one hour after purchasing the beans. I came back to see that they had called the towing company who had put a wheel-lock on my car and made me pay for it.  In terms of actual coffee service, it all depends on the barista so it's very inconsistent. And for the most part they don't do latte art.

Best coffee shop in town. Love the owners, everyone that works there. They are family and treat everyone as family. Freshly roasted beans - Central American Fusion is our favorite. We've been coming here every morning we are in town since we moved to NoDa in 2013. This is what a local coffeeshop is all about.
good coffee and great service
The hipster vibes are strong with this one. Great atmosphere and coffee.
I love a good cubano. Outstanding.
It's the best neighborhood coffee house in Charlotte. Great value, flavor, and peopke!
Always a great Cuban coffee! The staff is so friendly.
Super friendly staff and fun environment. The coffee is delicious and the staff really know their stuff if you're looking to add something to the coffee! We enjoy visiting here when we're in NoDa!
The coffee is great, and your staff is probably the best I have encountered at any coffee shop! My boyfriend went in and said there was no way he was not tipping them because they were all so nice!
Always like coming here to grab great coffee or a chai tea latte. The people that work here just happen to be awesome as well.

I love this place. Great coffee. I love that they roast it themselves and i love how clean they keep it. And the staff is friendly and great as is the owner. I cant wait to have the opportunity to work here. Simply superb and splendid. Cant wait to come back
Absolutely wonderful! All the employees are positive and upbeat and the food and drinks are great! I come here often just for the good vibes.
Great no carb breakfast! Love the theme. Hear baristas!

Absolutely love this place. People are great. Amazing coffee and tea options. My personal fav is there chai latte. I would like to say this that Chai latte I had here was one of the best I ever had.  A go to place to chill around.
This was my haunt in high school over ten years ago and I'm always happy to return when I'm in town. Right in the middle of NoDa with the best coffee in town and pleasant outdoor seating.

Took a visitor from out of town here and they loved it just as much as I do. The vibe is great, the coffee is excellent, and though I haven't tried any of the pastries, the way they look is enough to make me sneak one in some time. The location is awesome too!
LOVE this find while in Charlotte for the weekend. Thanks to TripAdvisor. We love local roasters that make a tasty brew.
Great coffee and friendly service at a fair price. If you're in the neighborhood it's worth stopping by.
Good place for coffee and pastries
Great coffee with an equally excellent atmosphere.

Been going to Smelly Cat for over a decade. Love the coffee. Loved the old vibe. LOVE the new vibe! So excited to see such a wonderful business grow and succeed! Highly recommend for meetings and solo sessions.
Excellent coffee and great place to hangout
nothing smelly about the coffee here.  it's all good aromariffic in beautiful NoDa neighborhood.
Best. Coffee. I. Have. Ever. Had!
Cozy interior espresso drinks with a unique sweetness
Nice coffee shop with some nice alternative drinks.  Chai milkshake was really good!
Great coffee, excellent service, good atmosphere.
Very popular coffee place in NODA. Quality and ambiance is 10/10
Good coffee and a killer breakfast burrito. Get serenaded by the birds if you enjoy your breakfast out in the morning sun. Pleasant experience.

The real thing that matters, the coffee is AMAZING(5 stars). A great selection of roasts and a suffient choice in preperations. Tasty offering of pastires and other baked goods. Seating area was confined and limited (inside). Parking wasn't terrible, circle a few times and chances are you'll get a spot.

Great cafe even for families!  We took the kids with us.  We spent $25 for 2 coffees, 4 hot chocolates ( for our kiddos ), and 3 large pastries to share.  Great coffee, delicious sweets, and great atmosphere!
Good coffee, friendly staff, and a solid place to work out of!
Consistently offers perfectly brewed rich coffee and lovingly prepared breakfast and pastry options.  Set in the funky NODA vibe.

The coffee was amazing.  I had the dirty chai latte.  The decor is cool it reminds you of a CLEAN dive bar.  It is not a lot of seating inside and the crowd appeared to be early 20's.  They do have free WIFI though.  It worth going to again for sure.
Cozy little place. Loved the menu options. Amazing vibe. They have games. Played this fun game called Double Shutter. Try it.
I like that they roast their own coffee. The staff and service are also great.

Liked the environment. Seemed like a good place to hang out. I think the music was too loud to chill and read but that is my preference I am sure some people like that level of noise. I got regular drip coffee and a bacon, egg, and cheese all of which we more than acceptable
I love the theme of this place. I'll be there for you. The coffee was good too!
The only place to get great blended ice drinks (Frappes) in Charlotte!
Great beverages and atmosphere
Love the coffee and the atmosphere, great for meetings, homework, dates, etc.
Always good coffee at the Smelly Cat!
Dirty Chai Latte is Amazing
Awesome spot

Great place to grab a coffee, snack or a drink. It's small but cozy and the coffee is fantastic. They have a few varieties and roasts for you to select from and are knowledgable about each. Seating is a bit limited inside but they do have a fair amount of outdoor seating.
Heather and Jessica were delightful to meet. I really enjoyed myself there and i HIGHLY RECOMMEND Smelly Cat...
Small no frills coffee house with excellent staff, great coffee and grub. Perfect spot in NoDa for those cold winter mornings.

Had the Cuban & the Vegan Bar The coffee was really bold I loved it! The vegan bar was delicious!! Only thing is that I was talking with the barista when I was making my order and I told her I love expresso but it's over too quickly I was asking how much coffee oz.  comes in the espresso and in the Cuban... but she never mentioned the Cortadito... Wish she would of suggested a Cortadito.. Could of saved $3 of I would of ordered it originally instead of the cuban.  I bought one after I finished the Cuban & the vegan bar. Other than that love the vibe! Its nice and cozy in here!
Good coffee and nice atmosphere. Perfect spot for a calm Sunday morning before exploring the area.
Amazing coffee and great atmosphere!!

Coffee shop in funky NoDa. Proper place with plenty of smiling faces behind the barrista bar. Glad to see a gender-neutral bathroom, glad to see a pour-over on the menu, glad to experience a proper black iced tea. Avoid the fruity rice marshmallow treat as it is mostly marshmallow! Everything else was awesome.

Good coffee place in NoDa... Which is an even better neighbor.  Good selection of coffee options.  Not really a food place but not all coffee places need to have food.  They do one thing and do it well. I'd say their espresso is fruity v nutty just FYI.
Came here twice in two days! Dirty Chai was delicious!
Great space to sit and be cozy. Ordered an americano with oat milk. It was purrfect!!!!
Very special place, great coffee and muffins!
The best Chai latte I've had! The place is nice and the employees are welcoming!
Really good coffee and friendly service. The place was pretty packed on a Sunday morning. I definitely plan on going back to try a tea latte.

Great local spot with a ton of barista type coffee options. Funky decor and seating both inside and out. Beers on tap and brunch breakfast sandwiches. What more could you ask for? One of my favorite spots in Noda.
I love this place

"Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, what are they feeding you" that song plays in my head the whole time I'm at this place. Great selection of drinks, pastries, and super cute atmosphere.  Great for hanging out with friends, grabbing a quick drink, or even a business meeting if you want to get away from the chain of starbucks (which i'm not really a fan of). Definitely on the small size so I wouldn't recommend bringing a huge group.

NoDa is the artsy and quirky side of Charlotte and this cute little coffee shop fits right in! Not only is their coffee delicious but they have wonderful customer service. The shop itself is small but they have both indoor and outdoor seating and a very laid back atmosphere which makes it a great place to work or chat with a friend.
Very nice atmosphere but very bud muffins. Chai tea latte too sweet.
Great laid back community coffee hub. Loved their regular coffee. Nice place to chill and wake up
Coffee is superb especially  theur frappes
Loved the house roast - cool atmosphere and vibe.

Great coffee and funny name. When you bring your own travel mug, they give you a 10c token to place in one of multiple buckets hanging on the wall, each one representing a different charity. Cool concept!
Delicious coffee and great service
Wow. The quality and price is amazing!!! New favorite spot!!!
Not sure what the hype is. Coffee is good not great. But fun quirky spot so 4 not 3.

Great coffee in a good atmosphere. Docking 1 star because food options are limited - not the place if you want a gourmet breakfast sandwich or the perfect bagel. But perfect for coffee and a basic breakfast item if you're hungry.
Great coffee,  friendly service.
Very cute little coffee-Shop with very nice patio and excellent coffee
Great place to get a solid cup of coffee at a reasonable price. They even serve breakfast sandwiches; pre made or made to order. The outside seating is perfect and has much character.
It was a great place to stop and have an adult beverage and snack for the kiddo
Best coffee shop ever. Very deep flavor. We routinely order Noda Night Espresso coffee bean from here and enjoy in my home too!!
Hands down best coffee shop in Charlotte. I'm very picky with my coffee and this place has NEVER let me down.
Amazing!!!! Great feeling very cozy‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è‚ù§Ô∏è

(Translated by Google) Delicious coffee, cozy interior, nice and friendly staff. Unfortunately, we didn't manage to try the quiche (for some reason it was not available), but the girl at the checkout suggested a place nearby where you can have breakfast.  Unfortunately, the drinking water is tasteless and may not be filtered. Love this place! I can't brag enough about their coffee. The service was amazing, the staff was friendly! We will recommend it to our friends and we will be returning!
Very relaxed atmoshpere, plenty of comfortable seating, and a great outdoor environment also
The very best coffee anyone could ever imagine and a great friendly staff,
Fun little area for a morning coffee, pet friendly.

I can understand why this place has good ratings, but I must have had the misfortune of running into the two most rude baristas employed here. Condescending, messed up my order, and while preparing my coffee proceeded to make fun of my wife and I via imitation and snarky comments about our clothes.
Perfect lil' anytime coffee house and my favorite work space. Great staff! Quiet atmosphere. And my mom's zucchini bread (best yet). :)

Love the name! Drinks are delicious, and baristas are very friendly! The indoor seating area is very cozy, and the dog-friendly patio is a wonderful place to enjoy your fresh brew and good conversation(:
The best cold brew I've ever passed across my tongue! I think my blend of choice was the Ethiopian? Anyway the barista can tell you all about the different choices. A must-try NoDa landmark!

Do you remember Phoebe's song- smelly cat? :) Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, What are they feeding you? Smelly Cat, Smelly Cat, It's not your fault  Well this coffee house in Charlotte has no connection to it. :) Smelly Cat Coffeehouse Roaster is an award-winning local coffeehouse and Coffee Roaster. It's located in the NoDa neighborhood in Charlotte and is very charming and quirky. The coffee house has seating in the front, side of building and inside. The inside is decorated in this rustic farmhouse vibe and is a very cozy space. They have a few nooks inside for seating two.  The barista that served my friend and I was very pleasant and patient with us. It was our first visit so it took us a moment to decide on our drink of choice  for the hot and humid Sunday afternoon.  I ended up ordering an ice latte with toasted coconut syrup and almond milk. I took a sip and thought, man oh man, this is a good cup of coffee. The coffee had a smooth and bright flavor, no bitter taste. This would definitely be my go to coffee shop if I lived here. Great coffee, funky atmosphere and good service - love it!

A great neighborhood coffee shop. It's very small, but has comfortable seating. You can get standard coffees here or small lunches/snacks. They also have outside seating in the shade among other areas around the shop. I love buying their beans and making my own coffee at home.
Fantastic Coffee, delecious breads and breakfast biscuits, plus extremely nice staff, especially Zeke is so friendly and attentive! Love the relaxing vibe and covered porch. Will be back often :-)
Love this coffee shop. They have 4 cold brews on tap which are absolutely delicious. I also love their customer service and ambiance.
Good coffe, great if you are going with a friend, but not the place to go to if you want to get some work done on your labtap. There place is busy and there aren't enough outlets to go around.
I have a serious dependence on this place. Best dirty chai you'll ever have. Super-consistent quality on all drinks I've had. Favorite coffee shop in Charlotte!
The best dirty chai latte
This is a cool little place. They cofffee is always made quickly.  The staff is pretty friendly.
Great coffee great atmosphere
Great coffee but limited food options
Best latte in charlotte! Love the environment, decor, and friendly staff.  Absolutely adore this place!

Really awesome place! Came here, got some coffee, and sat down to do some work for a few hours. The inside is nice and the WiFi is pretty good. They also have tons of covered outdoor seating. Definitely pet friendly as they provide a water bowl for dogs

This place is BUSY. They certainly shouldn't have much trouble making money considering the number of people they have in this small establishment. Still plenty of seating considering the outside patio area, but since I sat outside I could easily watch the ongoing traffic throughout the area. I'm not sure how the previous reviews had much time to have a bad interaction with any of the employees because we ordered and moved out of the way before there was much time for interaction. I had a Mocha and my friend had vanilla latte, both tasted good.
Cute coffee house.  Staff was very friendly and make great lattes!
Out shines Starbucks any day, extremely smooth and delicious frappes.

This place was really cool, the barista offered me samples of the different cold brews they had and told me about each of them, all of them were great. Will definitely go back next time I'm in Charlotte.
I was super impressed by the shop. The staff was very accommodating to me, explained in good detail their offerings, even when busy. And a really cool scene.
Unique and cool coffee house. Good amount of various brews,well worth a visit
Great place for coffee. Wish they close at 10 PM every day.
Nice place and good drinks
Delicious  coffee
Great atmosphere wonderful service!
Loved the coffee, friendly staff, and cozy atmosphere.
Delicious cafe goodies (try the Sledgehammer if there is a defibrillator nearby) and the Barristas have great personalities!
Super friendly staff! Delicious coffe and food! I love this place :)
Great coffee! Unfortunately they don't carry oat milk like other coffee shops. Hopefully they do in the future.
One of the best places for coffee in Charlotte
Very cute unique little coffee shop! You have people that just make coffee and people who know how to make coffee and these guys KNOW.
Very good coffee, amazing look, and retro home feel.
Cozy artzy like a Starbucks without the commercialized tang
Best coffee I have ever had in Charlotte.
It's always great ... :)

I wish I could have given zero stars I been to this place a couple of times before I love their hot chocolate. I recently been to this place had a pretty bad experience had ordered an hot chocolate which is my all time favourite but the lady who was working at that time was being racist towards me based on my ethnicity.I basically happen to ask her since my hot chocolate was a bit luke warm asked for an extra hot one. This lady gave me an attitude which I feel like it's very unethical they are not supposed to treat a customer in that way no matter where you from. I decided never to visit this place again in my life time if I get a separate treatment based on my demographics.
Cute place! Love the Friends affiliation. It's nice on the inside and the food is decent.
I feel like they're putting too much effort into the appearance of the coffee shop and lacking on the coffee quality these days.
A wonderfully quirky coffeehouse in the heart of NoDa. Much better than that place from Seattle who's name we shall not utter!

We went for the quiches at 10.30am and we were told they were not making any more for the day... They didn't have the brewed coffee I wanted and advertised, so they suggested another one, more expensive and not much better. Disappointed...
Always quick and friendly, plus baristas know what they are doing!

Best coffee shop in Charlotte - hands down. The staff is always friendly and personable, the brown sugar syrup is to die for, and the food is kind of unexpectedly delicious (the zucchini bread and bacon &a egg breakfast burrito are personal favorites). Love this place!
Very hipster and amazing coffee. One of my must go to place whenever visiting Charlotte.
Mad chill atmosphere, great coffee

What I remember the most is how pleasant Julia was during ordering and making my blended chai tea. She was extremely patience and helpful. Julia is an asset to your business. Thank her for me. : )) Mary McDonald
Great atmosphere & nice people! BEST ALMOND LATTE I've ever had.
Great coffee, cold brew
Great place for coffee.  Can be tight for space during busy times.
5 stars for the ambience. A very nice place with a very nice selection of coffee.

$2.50 for a refill after paying $3 for a coffee? Yo have to be kidding me. I have worked in several coffee houses and this is highway robbery ESPECIALLY when I was told they give refills. So I went about my errands to run back for the refill, without my purse, to hear that a refill was $2.50 . . . . um no. I live in the 'hood and try to avoid the place because it is overpriced and will certainly never go back. Oh by the way staff . . . I know a passive aggressive snarky "Thank you" as I walk out the door without my refill when I hear one. Rude.
Do not go to this location! They will tow your car if you leave the establishment. Very unprofessional!
Very good coffee and their breakfast biscuits are deelish!
What's not to love about coffee!!!
The Norwegian word for good coffee is Smelly Cat.

The gingerbread latte and sausage biscuit really hit the spot. The staff was courteous and helpful, especially the blonde barista. I really enjoyed the quaint atmosphere. I'll definitely visit again when I'm in the area.
The Ecuadorian pour over is the best!! They have great sandwiches for breakfast and the employees are always super nice!
